meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the puparia to learn more about the life cycle of insects.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with puparia from the cocoons of butterflies.
meanings.sent3: The puparia decided to have a race to see who would emerge as a butterfly first.
meanings.sent4: The puparia hung from the branches like tiny lanterns lighting up the garden.
meanings.sent5: The children collected puparia to observe the magical transformation into butterflies.

meanings.definition: The protective case or covering in which a pupa develops.
meanings.sent1: The puparia shielded the delicate pupa as it transformed inside.
meanings.sent2: The puparia of the moth was camouflaged to blend in with the tree bark.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the puparia as tiny helmets for acorn soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The puparia served as a fortress protecting the pupa during its metamorphosis.
meanings.sent5: The puparia glistened in the sunlight, revealing the hidden beauty within.
